properties.areaDesc: Yukon Delta; Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Lower Yukon Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 8 at 11:21AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
A brief warming trend across the West Coast and Interior will
come to an abrupt end beginning late Sunday.

Low pressure will move north along the coast through the day
Saturday and weaken over the Chukchi Sea early Sunday. As the low
passes, winds will turn westerly, bringing an influx of cold air
back to the region.

High pressure will strengthen across the region, further cooling
temperatures into next week. Widespread 20s to 30s below can be
expected along the coast by late Monday. 30s to 40s below can be
expected in the Western Interior.

Models show a considerable spread in temperatures later in the
week, so there is fairly low confidence in the long term forecast.
For now we expect cold temperatures to linger throughout the
week.

Residents should prepare for cold temperatures, especially if
traveling, by keeping cold weather gear available at all times.

For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/afg
